title: HelloThere/0692
text: Persistent Lith Mounts:  Use Browser Storage to "Remember" the most recently mounted  Lith and restore that on session launch (will still necessarily prompt for permission each time)

title: HelloThere/08343
text:
Dynamic 'infix' formulas supported 
`1/79 = <<calc " 1/79">>`
1/79 = <<calc " 1/79">>

title: HelloThere/09598
text: # Known Issues

title: HelloThere/10691
text: Lithic has sane printing defaults; it prints only the styled markdown content from all pages open in the main view. This makes it suited for quick homework or similar submissions when you don't need heavy typesetting like Latex.

title: HelloThere/11196
text: You can "re-merge" your Lith with the `lithic.uk` webapp by dragging and dropping the lith directly onto the browser window.

title: HelloThere/16970
text: Currently drawings/whiteboards cannot be deleted directly, they must first be changed do a different 'type' and then deleted.

title: HelloThere/24846
text: Double-Click to edit 'nodes' (bulleted text)

title: HelloThere/26907
text: use discord-style ``/slashcommands`` for most formatting and insertion. like ``/draw``

title: HelloThere/27287
text: > Lithic is built on the magic of   `TiddlyWiki`;   its a mild extension of  `TiddlyStudy` with a good dose of my opinions.

title: HelloThere/27802
text: Lithic is an 100% client-side webapp; heavily inspired by Logseq.

title: HelloThere/29301
text: A little bit "fancier" header styles for printing stories.

title: HelloThere/29564
text: Your edits are temporarily stored in browser storage.

text: Note: You can revert all temporary changes with the "Revert" button.

title: HelloThere/4736
text: "Mount a Local Lith": Button that will prompt for a local Lith, load it, and then autosave all edits back to the Lith in 'realtime.' Lasts for 1 session.
